meanings.definition: Failing to perform as well as expected or desired.
meanings.sent1: The underachieving student struggled to keep up with the class.
meanings.sent2: The team's underachieving performance disappointed their coach.
meanings.sent3: The underachieving plant refused to bloom despite ample sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her underachieving phone battery died just when she needed it most.
meanings.sent5: The underachieving car sputtered and stalled on the highway.

meanings.definition: Not reaching one's full potential in academic or professional pursuits.
meanings.sent1: The underachieving employee rarely took on extra tasks at work.
meanings.sent2: The student's underachieving grades did not reflect her true abilities.
meanings.sent3: The underachieving chef burned toast on a regular basis.
meanings.sent4: His underachieving marathon time left him feeling unsatisfied.
meanings.sent5: The underachieving artist never pursued gallery exhibitions.
